column3: Les fumeurs de haschisch sont inoffensifs...
column6: Estos fumadores de hachís son inofensivos...

column2: Word is spreading that a man named Vladimir Solin has found ancient lore that he connects with his ridiculous heresy, the Stalinist faith. Through secret training, his men have become lethal killers and have managed to seize a castle in western Russia. Already many of his open opponents have died in mysterious circumstances, all tracing back to this new organization that calls itself the KGB.
The KGB Spread To The Baltic
These madmen may have more reach than we imagined...

Nobody seriously thought that the secretive society known as the KGB would last long, but they have proven far more resilient than anyone ever imagined. Now they have infiltrated a series of fortifications in the land of Lativia, claiming that Riga is a place claimed by the mythical organisation they take their name from. Regardless of the veracity of their claims, the fact remains that their power and influence has spread to the icy lands of the Baltic.

Nobody believed that us, the KGB would last long out in the open, but we have proven ourselves far more resilient than any infinidel ever imagined. Now our faithfull agents have infiltrated a series of fortifications in the land of Lativia, the mighty fortress of Riga being one of the many castles under the ancient organisation we, faithfull to Lord Stalin are a continuation of.
The notorious KGB have expanded their influence yet again, seizing yet another castle, this time one in Eastern Germany.
We, the ever-faithull KGB have expanded our influence yet again, seizing yet another castle, this time one in Eastern Germany.

Being established by the legendary Guru Hargobind, sixth Guru of the Sikhs,the Akali Nihang, or 'Egoless Immortals', devote themselves to the selfless defence of the Sikh faithful. They are famed for their victories even when heavily outnumbered. However, some of their practices, such as the consumption of 'Sukha Parshaad' are frowned upon by mainstream Sikhs.
Partake of Sukha Parshaad, the 'Dry-Sweet' drink made of crushed herbs which is said to bring the mind closer to God.
Allows you to imbibe of the sacred 'dry-sweet' nectar, which can bring you closer to union with God.
Has not already partaken of the Holy Drink
As you drink the sacred herbal mixture, the world seems to fall away around you. A strange, warm feeling comes over you. You see something in the distance. You see...
A vision of the Immortal one - of God!
A vision of a terrible battle between the forces of good and evil
A vision of being married to a ravishingly beautiful spouse

Founded by Neeraj, great holy man and reincarnation of the Mahatma, the Neerajis have taken Jainism in a far more missionary and evangelical direction through the last few centuries. They send missions far and wide, helping the faithful Jina and establishing Monastic Communities to act as centers of religion.

The Evangelical Order of the Cross was originally a Lutheran order devoted to common living in service of Christ. Founded in Germany, the Order expanded to permit Protestants from many different traditions,  and has members from all over the Christian world.

The Order of the Golden Coin is a scholarly fraternity dedicated to the study of the works, words, and commandments of Alfred Nobel. Adherents devote themselves to the inner meaning of Nobel's teachings, rather than the attempt to explore and find answers in the discovery of Old World knowledge.

For centuries, those who desire to study the Novel more deeply have banded together in the ancient society known as The Inklings. Scholars, priests, and authors have developed many varied practices for the better understanding and interpretation of the sacred texts.

Before the Event, the Queen would prize her most loyal followers with the tile of Knight. Those great men would have the unmatched honor of serving her closely. Until the Queen comes back, it is this Lodge of her mightiest followers that takes the role of selecting the most valiant heroes to serve her.
Has a §YLiege§!, §YVassal§!, or a §Yneighboring ruler§! who follows the §Thelemic§!, §Old Thelemic§! or §Summer Queen§! faith\n
column3: A un §Yseigneur lige§!, un §Yvassal§! ou un §Yseigneur voisin§! qui suit la foi §Yesoteric§!\n
column4: Hat einen §YLehnsherrn§!, §YVasallen§! oder §Ybenachbarten Herrscher§!, der dem §Yesoteric§! Glauben folgt\n
column6: Tiene un §Yseñor§!, §Yvasallo§!, o §Ygobernante vecino§! que sigue la fe §Yesoteric§!\n

column2: In ancient times, the Great Khan ruled the plains from China to far Rus, the hooves of his followers destroying any enemy on their path. After the Event, the Khanist greatest warriors swore to embody his fury, and formed the lodge of the Wrath of the Khan.
Has a §YLiege§!, §YVassal§!, or a §Yneighboring ruler§! who follows the §YKhanist§! faith\n

column2: In the harsh plains of the Kazakh Plains, the water of the Aral Sea is a treasure. The Ironists believe it has to be protected at all costs from further damage, and the Protectors of the Aral are the greatest chariotiers that make a oath to defend it from any that might cause harm to it.
Has a §YLiege§!, §YVassal§!, or a §Yneighboring ruler§! who follows the §YIronist§! faith\n
column3: A un §Yseigneur lige§!, un §Yvassal§! ou un §Yseigneur voisin§! qui suit la foi §Yironist§!\n

column2: The legendary hero only known as the White Wolf instructed the Vedmak	s during the Event on how to drive away the evil spirits that torment the world. However, he also left behind instructions on fighting said spirits and other enemies. The School of the White Wolf is formed by those that wish to learn to fight those elusive creatures.
Has a §YLiege§!, §YVassal§!, or a §Yneighboring ruler§! who follows the §YFolklorist§! faith\n

column2: It is said that Maushiva and his followers once hunted the dangerous Sparrow Devils far and wide. The Mauxiantes to this day are on a war with the sparrows, messengers of chaos and famine, and the Sparrow Hunters take on the mission of destroying any of the birds. To this end, they train endlessly, becoming the most lethal bowmen in the world.
Has a §YLiege§!, §YVassal§!, or a §Yneighboring ruler§! who follows the §Ymaunaxite§! faith\n

column2: The legendary Ringbearer that stole the ring from the evil hands of Richelieu and the White Witch and burned it into the Vesuvius, defeating Sauron forever, was accompanied by many great heroes, including the legendary Aragorn, the Pevensie siblings and Asterix the Dwarf. Following the footsteps of those legendary heroes, the Fellowship of the Ring trains to form a new company of valian warriors.
Has a §YLiege§!, §YVassal§!, or a §Yneighboring ruler§! who follows the §YNovelist§! faith\n

column2: The Zarists believe that, long before the Event, the greatest army that ever existed, the White Army, fought against the trecherous Red Army in a struggle to defend the Tzar. After the Event, the Zarists formed a new White Army, to train themselves in the art of war and protect the future Tzars.
Has a §YLiege§!, §YVassal§!, or a §Yneighboring ruler§! who follows the §YZarist§!, §Katerinist§! or §Petrist§! faith\n

column2: The Warriors of the Monolith follow the steps of the legendary Monolith fighters who faught The Marked One in Antediluvian times, forming warrior bands that fight for the glory of the Noosphere. As they wander the frozen tundra, they seek to return to the lost city of Pripyat, and to this end search for the mightiest warriors to cut a path for Nousthreskians.
Has a §YLiege§!, §YVassal§!, or a §Yneighboring ruler§! who follows the §Nousthreskeia§! faith\n

column2: The Fianna follow the steps of legendary Heroes such as Finn MacCool and CuCulainn, forming warrior bands that fight for the glory of the Druidic gods. As they land in the ancient continent of Europe, they seek to return to the lost land of the druids, and to this end search for the mightiest warriors to fight for the reconquest.
Has a §YLiege§!, §YVassal§!, or a §Yneighboring ruler§! who follows the §Druidic§! faith\n

column2: As the Sky Bull killed Enkidu, the great king and first of his Brothers, Gilgamesh, went on a mission to search immortality, and ultimately came as close to his goal as any man could, but ultimately failed. The Brothers of Enkidu take the mantle of the mission of bringing immortality to humanity. As this search is dangerous and will certainly kill the unprepared, the Brothers train to reach the might of the Great King.
Has a §YLiege§!, §YVassal§!, or a §Yneighboring ruler§! who follows the §YMesopotamian§! faith\n

column2: This character is a tireless soldier of the Akali Nihang, well-versed in the traditional ways of warfare in the Punjab.
This character claims to bear the powers which only can only achieved by the blessing of Panoramix.
This character learnt to move rapidly in difficult terrains and catch the enemy with ambushes.
This character follows an aggressive battle tactics and even personally charge the enemy.
This character is charismatic and cunning enough to effectively lead large group of his soldiers.
This character can launch enormous and terrifying charges.
This character has perfect vision and never misses [This.GetHerHis] target.
This character regularly plays a sacred ancient strategy game that is played on hexagrams.
This character learnt to do breathtaking maneuvers with the rapid changes of speed and direction.
Has not been approached by devil workshipers before.
column3: N'a pas déjà été approché par le Illuminati.
column4: Wurde noch nicht von den Illuminati angesprochen.
column6: Nunca ha tenido contacto con el Illuminati.

column2: Attempt to find out whether §Y[Root.GetTitledFirstName]§! lusts for the power of the occult. If so, you may offer [Root.GetHerHim] to join your Society.
column3: Tenter de savoir si [Root.Get_le_TitledFirstNameJ] convoite les puissances occultes.Si c'est le cas, vous pourriez lui proposer de rejoindre votre société.
column4: Versuche herauszufinden, ob §Y[Root.GetTitledFirstName]§! nach okkulter Macht trachtet. Falls dem so ist, könnt Ihr [Root.GetHerHim] in den Kreis der Jünger Eures Zirkels einladen.
column6: Averigua si §Y[Root.GetTitleFirstName]§! codicia el poder de las fuerzas ocultas. En caso afirmativo, puedes invitarlo/la a unirse a tu sociedad.

column2: The ultimate cause of the Event which destroyed Old Europe is shrouded in mystery. However, there is one theory that has persisted through the ages. It claims that a secret society used supernatural powers to bring down Old Europe for their own evil ends. Some say this society still exists today, and that they are looking for new members...

Brethren pirates regularly engage in acts that many view as barbaric, but they at least follow a code of conduct... at least, most of them do. Some pirates disregard the sacred Brethren Code and extract more than their fair share of Neptune's bounty using unspeakable methods. They are followers of Davy Jones - Davy Jones' Mates.

Despite its innocuous name, the Church of Starry Wisdom is a dangerous cult, even by Occultist standards. Its members worship an Old One whose true name has been lost to time. The only thing known for sure is that the god they worship sadistically wreaks havoc on Earth, using eldritch powers to cruelly kill and torture humans. His followers are said to do the same...

The Unseelie Court is said to be founded by corrupted fairies. There are many myths about it, such as its members provided materials for Frankenstein's unholy work. Some consider these just tales but others believe they still hold gatherings in the forests at midnight...
The Grand Master of the Illuminati.
